Description: Blue glazed composition shabti of Sety I with black detail: a striated lappet-wig, a modelled face and parallel hands with a bracelet and two hoes; three(surviving) rows of faded Hieroglyphic text on the leg; seed-basket on the back; lower-leg section lost.
Exhibition history: 2017-2018 10 Oct-14 April, Sir John Soane’s Museum, London, The Great Belzoni: Egyptology’s Pioneer
